pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.2: a certain brahmin had invited the nuns for a meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.3: After the nuns had eaten and expressed their satisfaction, they went to their respective families, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.4: Soon afterwards that brahmin said this to his neighbors,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.5: “The nuns have been satisfied by me. Come, and I’ll satisfy you, too.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.8: Those nuns who were invited by you came to our houses, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.9: That brahmin complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.10: “How can they eat in our house and afterwards eat elsewhere? Am I not able to give them as much as they want?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.11: The nuns heard the complaints of that brahmin,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.12: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.13: “How can nuns finish their meal and express their satisfaction, and then eat elsewhere?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.14: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.17: “… How can nuns finish their meal and express their satisfaction, and then eat elsewhere?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.18: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.19: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:1.20: ‘If a nun who has been invited or expressed her satisfaction eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.6: invited to eat any of the five staple foods.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.8: eating is seen, staple food is seen, it is offered by one standing within arm’s reach, a refusal is seen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.10: apart from the five staple foods, rice-porridge, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.13: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.14: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1.15: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.1: If she has been invited, and she perceives that she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.2: If she has been invited, but she is unsure if she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.3: If she has been invited, but she does not perceives that she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.4: If she receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.5: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.7: if she has been invited, but not expressed her satisfaction;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.9: if she eats after getting permission from the first inviter;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.10: if, when there is a reason, she makes use of post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.12: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.2.13: The fourth training rule is finished.
